main event: On 20 September 1956, an unidentified aerial object was sighted in the Pacific Ocean. The object was described as a black, circular entity, approximately 50-100 meters in diameter, and it was observed moving slowly and silently for about 2 minutes from a moving aircraft.

The object was described as a black, circular entity, approximately 50-100 meters in diameter, and it was moving slowly and silently.
The details of the object were difficult to determine due to darkness, and it did not appear to do anything unusual during the observation.

The report mentions that the object was not photographed, and the duration of the sighting was considered short for a rocket or balloon, suggesting that the beginning of the sighting may have been missed.
